subject: p18224196
History: History of hypertension, mitral regurgitation, and AFib with new dyspnea on exertion. Evaluate for pulmonary edema.
Findings: Moderate bilateral pleural effusions, larger on the right than on the left, are unchanged. The previously noted pulmonary edema has resolved. There is no consolidation. Mild right basilar atelectasis persists. There is no pneumothorax. Moderate enlargement of the cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable.
Impression: Stable moderate bilateral pleural effusions. Resolution of pulmonary edema.
